title: Is there a group of people that write books in Pinyin for beginners? - Quora

response.answer_text: Such books are to be born. Pinyin is perfect for writing Mandarin. Trust me and forgive me for not elaborating, as I’ve included this view together with pinyin texts I wrote myself in my other answers. Mind you, a lot of people, Chinese or non-Chinese, rely on characters for their livelihood. Of course they shall not donate pinyin to you. To get around Hanzi Wall: Hightlight texts, Copy, Paste, Convert and Refine. To write pinyin articles, you may use iPad self defined dictionary and short cuts. For example, tpye yw, you’ll get yinwei; type sy, you’ll get suoyi, etc. http://m.fuhaoku.com/tool/pinyin.html

There are books wrtten in simple Chinese. The best series I can think of is John DeFrancis' Beginning / Intermediate / Advanced Chinese readers. BCR starts with very simple texts that repeat the same common characters over and over again. I have thought of producing some easy reading texts all in romanization, but it may not be worth the effort.
